Class Game

  • java.lang.Object
    • Game

  • public class Game
extends java.lang.Object
    The Game Class will deal with the construction of, running of and the changes in between levels of the game.
    Creation Date: 26/11/19.
    Last Modification Date: 4/12/19.
    Version:
    1.4
    Author:
    Timothy Roger (977422), Szymon Grzech (988065)

    • Method Detail

      • runGame

        public void runGame(java.lang.String username,
                    int levelID,
                    boolean isSaveFile,
                    int deathCount)
        Starts the game for the player from a point based on the parameters handed to the method.
        Parameters:
        username - String - the username of the player playing the game, will be used if saving a position in a level.
        levelID - int - indicates the level the player will be playing in the game.
        isSaveFile - boolean - will be true if the player is going to play from a saved location.
        deathCount - int - the current cumulative deathcount the player has on the level.

      • buildGUI

        public javafx.scene.layout.Pane buildGUI()
        Creates a Pane instance for the game. This includes a button to open the in game menu and space for the display of the gameplay itself.
        Returns:
        the created Pane object.

      • returnToMain

        private void returnToMain()

      • processKeyEvent

        public void processKeyEvent(javafx.scene.input.KeyEvent event)
        Process a key event due to a key being pressed, e.g., to the player.
        Parameters:
        event - The key event that was pressed.

      • drawGame

        private void drawGame()
        Draws the game for the player.

      • changeSkin

        private void changeSkin()
        Changes the skin of the game, will cycle through the possible choices with each click.
